newsitem.title: ITALY: Deutsche Bank buys stake in 21 Investimenti.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche Bank buys stake in 21 Investimenti.

text.p: Deutsche Bank bought a five percent interest in 21 Investimenti, the industrial holding company controlled by Italy's Benetton family, the company said in a statement on Tuesday.
The statement did not disclose what the bank paid for its stake in 21 Investimenti.

Investimenti controls a range of interests in sportswear but does not have any stake in casual clothes producer Benetton, which the Benetton family controls separately through its financial holding company Edizione Holding.
The statement said that Deutsche Bank would acquire its holding in 21 Investimenti by subscribing to a capital increase and would take up a seat on the board.
Other shareholders in the investment company include Banco Ambrosiano Veneto, Assicurazioni Generali and the Seragnoli group.
21 Investimenti's holdings have a turnover of more than 400 billion lire while net equity has tripled to 120 billion lire in three years, the statement said.
Interests include clothes maker Gruppo Basic-Robe di Kappa, olive oil maker "E Group", vitamin pills and energy drink producer Enervit, Gruppo Albatros and Spain's Picking Pack.
21 Investimenti chairman Alessandro Benetton said "our subsidiaries will be able to count on a global financial network which only a few banks are able to offer."
